___sendToServiceOwners.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: Whether the administrators (service and co-adiminstrators) of the service should be notified when the alert is activated.

___customEmails.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: A list of administrator's custom email addresses notifiy of the activation of the alert.

___action.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: The action that is performed when the alert rule becomes active, and when an alert condition is resolved.

___description.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: Description of the alert rule that will be included in the alert email.

___isEnabled.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: Indicates whether the alert rule is enabled.

Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___threshold.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: The threshold value that activates the alert. Only for ThresholdRuleConditions.

___dataSource.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: The resource from which the rule collects its data.

___resourceUri.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: The resource identifier of the resource the rule monitors.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___metricNamespace.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: Only should be present for availability level metrics, where the value must be WindowsAzure.Availability.

___metricName.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: The name of the metric that defines what the rule monitors.

___odata.type.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: Type of data source this condition uses.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___odata.type.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: Type of condition this alert rule uses.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___windowSize.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: The period of time that is used to monitor alert activity based on the threshold. Must be between 5 minutes and 1 day. ISO 8601 duration format.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___operator.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: The operator used to compare the data and the threshold.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___failedLocationCount.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: The number of locations that must fail to activate the alert. Only for LocationThresholdRuleConditions.

___condition.description: Microsoft.Insights/alertrules: The condition that results in the alert rule being activated.

___name.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The name of the autoscale setting.

___targetResourceUri.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The resource identifier of the resource that the autoscale setting should be added to.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___enabled.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: Specifies whether automatic scaling is enabled for the resource.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___name.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The name of the profile.

___capacity.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The number of instances that can be used during this profile.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___minimum.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The minimum number of instances for the resource.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___default.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The number of instances that will be set if metrics are not available for evaluation. The default is only used if the current instance count is lower than the default.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___maximum.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The maximum number of instances for the resource. The actual maximum number may be limited by the cores that are available.

___rules.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: Contains a collection of rules that provide the triggers and parameters for the scaling action. A maximum of 10 rules can be specified.

___metricTrigger.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The trigger that results in a scaling action.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___threshold.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The threshold of the metric that triggers the scale action.

___metricResourceUri.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The resource identifier of the resource the rule monitors.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___statistics.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: How the metrics from multiple instances are combined.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___timeAggregation.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: How the data that is collected should be combined over time. The default value is Average.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___timeWindow.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The range of time in which instance data is collected. This value must be greater than the delay in metric collection, which can vary from resource-to-resource. Must be between 12 hours and 5 minutes. ISO 8601 duration format.

___metricName.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The name of the metric that defines what the rule monitors.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___timeGrain.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The granularity of metrics the rule monitors. Must be one of the predefined values returned from metric definitions for the metric. Must be between 12 hours and 1 minute. ISO 8601 duration format.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___operator.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The operator that is used to compare the metric data and the threshold.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___type.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The type of action that should occur, this must be set to ChangeCount.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___value.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The number of instances that are involved in the scaling action. This value must be 1 or greater. The default value is 1.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___direction.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: Whether the scaling action increases or decreases the number of instances.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___cooldown.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The amount of time to wait since the last scaling action before this action occurs. Must be between 1 week and 1 minute. ISO 8601 duration format.

___fixedDate.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: A specific date for the profile. This element is not used if the Recurrence element is used.

___start.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The start time for the profile.

___timeZone.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The time zone of the start and end times for the profile.

___end.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The end time for the profile.

___recurrence.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The repeating times at which this profile begins. This element is not used if the FixedDate element is used.

___frequency.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: How often the schedule profile should take effect. This value must be Week, meaning each week will have the same set of profiles.

___schedule.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The scheduling constraints for when the profile begins.

___days.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: A collection of days that the profile takes effect on.

___hours.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: A collection of hours at which the profile takes effect at.

___timeZone.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: The time zone for the hours of the profile.

___minutes.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: A collection of minutes at which the profile takes effect at.

___profiles.description: Microsoft.Insights/autoscalesettings: Contains a collection of automatic scaling profiles that specify different scaling parameters for different time periods. A maximum of 20 profiles can be specified.
